item.title: Vintage Vegas: Remembering the New Frontier Hotel & Casino – and That Iconic Ladies V-Neck!
item.description:
A Frontier Spirit on the Strip

The Frontier Hotel and Casino, later rebranded as the New Frontier, holds a unique place in Las Vegas Strip history. Opened in 1942 as the Apache Hotel, it quickly became “The Frontier” to capitalize on the post-war Western craze. It stood as a symbol of the burgeoning Las Vegas – a place offering affordable entertainment and a gritty, energetic atmosphere that drew a different crowd than the more upscale resorts beginning to emerge. Unlike the glitz and glamour of the Sands or the Flamingo, the Frontier catered largely to a middle-class clientele, families, and those seeking a more casual gaming experience.
